title: Drawing, ca. 1720
medium: Pen and black ink; brush and rose, yellow and light blue watercolor, white gouache; graphite on off white laid paper
inscribed: In ink lower right: Daniel(us) Marot fecit
provenance: From the collection of Leon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Wide central and two narrow lateral panels are flanked by pilaster strips. Each of these and the two halfs of the dado show alternative suggestions for the decoration. The panels show representations of Europeans in  stylised Chinese landscapes. At left a party is shown in the open; at center a reception is shown; at right a group of hunters. Rinceaux ornament decorates the ceiling cove.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ca. 1720.
ca. 1720. Pen and black ink; brush and rose, yellow and light blue watercolor, white gouache; graphite on off white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-213.
